detaileddescription.para: Define SPI control commands for common usage
Define SPI control commands for master usage
Define SPI control commands for slave usage

Get current device status
Param type : uint32_t *
Param usage : store result of current status
Return value explanation :

Set the clock mode of spi transfer
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : spi clock mode to choose clock phase and clock polarity
Return value explanation :

Set spi data frame size
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : should > 0
Return value explanation : If dfs is not supported, then return E_SYS

Set the dummy data during spi transfer
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : dummy data to transfer
Return value explanation :

Set spi transmit success callback function when all required bytes are transmitted for interrupt method
Param type : DEV_CALLBACK * or NULL
Param usage : transmit success callback function for spi
Return value explanation :

Set spi receive success callback function when all required bytes are received for interrupt method
Param type : DEV_CALLBACK * or NULL
Param usage : receive success callback function for spi
Return value explanation :

Set spi transfer success callback function when all required transfer are done for interrupt method
Param type : DEV_CALLBACK * or NULL
Param usage : transfer success callback function for spi
Return value explanation :

Set spi transfer error callback function when something error happened for interrupt method
Param type : DEV_CALLBACK * or NULL
Param usage : transfer error callback function for spi
Return value explanation :

Set buffer in interrupt transmit, and it will set spi tranfer.
SPI master and slave mode use case For both master and slave mode, if you set tx buffer to NULL, when tx interrupt is enabled and entered into tx interrupt, it will automatically disable the tx interrupt, so when you want to transfer something, you need to set the tx buffer to Non-NULL and enable tx interrupt, when the tx buffer is sent, it will disable the tx interrupt and call tx callback function if available.
Param type : DEV_BUFFER * or NULL
Param usage : buffer structure pointer, if param is NULL, then it will set xfer to empty
Return value explanation :

Set buffer in interrupt receive, and it will set spi tranfer.
SPI master mode use case Similar to SPI_CMD_SET_TXINT_BUF
SPI slave mode use case Similiar to SPI_CMD_SET_TXINT_BUF
Param type : DEV_BUFFER * or NULL
Param usage : buffer structure pointer, if param is NULL, then it will set xfer to empty
Return value explanation :

Enable or disable transmit interrupt, for master mode, only one of tx and rx interrupt can be enabled, if tx interrupt is enabled, then rx interrupt can't be enabled.
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : enable(none-zero) or disable(zero) flag
Return value explanation :

Enable or disable receive interrupt, for master mode, only one of tx and rx interrupt can be enabled, if rx interrupt is enabled, then tx interrupt can't be enabled.
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : enable(none-zero) or disable(zero) flag
Return value explanation :

Start the transfer by polling
Param type : DEV_SPI_TRANSFER *
Param usage :
Return value explanation :

Start the transfer by interrupt
Param type : DEV_SPI_TRANSFER * or NULL
Param usage : If NULL, it will disable transfer interrupt, if not NULL, it will enable transfer interrupt
Return value explanation :

Abort current interrupt transmit operation if tx interrupt enabled, it will disable transmit interrupt, and set DEV_IN_TX_ABRT in status variable, and call the transmit callback function, when tx callback is finished, it will clear DEV_IN_TX_ABRT and return
Param type : NULL
Param usage :
Return value explanation :

Abort current interrupt receive operation if rx interrupt enabled, it will disable receive interrupt, and set DEV_IN_TX_ABRT in status variable, and call the receive callback function, when rx callback is finished, it will clear DEV_IN_TX_ABRT and return
Param type : NULL
Param usage :
Return value explanation :

Abort current interrupt transfer operation if transfer is issued, it will disable transfer interrupt, and set DEV_IN_XFER_ABRT in status variable, and call the transfer callback function, when xfer callback is finished, it will clear DEV_IN_XFER_ABRT and return
Param type : NULL
Param usage :
Return value explanation :

Do a software reset for SPI device, it will stop current transfer, and clear error state and bring device to normal state, set next condition to STOP
Param type : NULL
Param usage :
Return value explanation :

Flush spi tx fifo, this will clear the data in tx fifo
Param type : NULL
Param usage :
Return value explanation :

Flush spi rx fifo, this will clear the data in rx fifo
Param type : NULL
Param usage :
Return value explanation :

Enable spi device
Param type : NULL
Param usage : param is not required
Return value explanation :

Disable spi device, when device is disabled, only SPI_CMD_ENA_DEV, SPI_CMD_DIS_DEV, SPI_CMD_GET_STATUS and SPI_CMD_RESET commands can be executed, other commands will return E_SYS
Param type : NULL
Param usage : param is not required
Return value explanation :

Get how many bytes space in spi are available to transmit, this can be used in interrupt callback functions, cooperate with spi_write API to realize non-blocked write
Param type : int32_t *
Param usage : store the write available bytes, > 0 for available bytes, 0 for not available
Return value explanation :

Get how many bytes in spi are available to receive, this can be used in interrupt callback functions, cooperate with spi_read API to realize non-blocked read
Param type : int32_t *
Param usage : store the read available bytes, > 0 for available bytes, 0 for not available
Return value explanation :

Start the transfer by quad read
Param type : DEV_SPI_PAK *
Param usage :
Return value explanation :

select spi slave device
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : the number of spi slave device to select
Return value explanation : return E_SYS when selection can't be done, return E_CTX during transfer

de-select spi slave device
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : the number of spi slave device to de-select
Return value explanation : return E_SYS when selection can't be done, return E_CTX during transfer

Set spi frequency.
Param type : uint32_t
Param usage : spi freq
Return value explanation : no return
SPI Slave Select Line, start from 0
Set tx buffer of device spi transfer
Set rx buffer of device spi transfer
Calculate total length of current transfer without next transfer
Set next SPI transfer
Init spi transfer
Set extra information pointer of spi info
Get extra information pointer of spi info
Default spi data frame size
Slave is not selected
default dummy value for first open
Inactive state of serial clock is low, serial clock toggles in middle of first data bit
Inactive state of serial clock is low, serial clock toggles at start of first data bit
Inactive state of serial clock is high, serial clock toggles in middle of first data bit
Inactive state of serial clock is high, serial clock toggles at start of first data bit
Equal to SPI_CPOL_0_CPHA_0
Equal to SPI_CPOL_0_CPHA_1
Equal to SPI_CPOL_1_CPHA_0
Equal to SPI_CPOL_1_CPHA_1
SPI Clock Mode
SPI slave select line 0
SPI slave select line 1
SPI slave select line 2
SPI slave select line 3
SPI slave select line 4
SPI slave select line 5
SPI slave select line 6
SPI slave select line 7
SPI slave select line 8
SPI slave select line 9
SPI slave select line 10
SPI slave select line 11
SPI slave select line 12
SPI slave select line 13
SPI slave select line 14
SPI slave select line 15
SPI slave select line 16
SPI slave select line 17
SPI slave select line 18
SPI slave select line 19
SPI slave select line 20
SPI slave select line 21
SPI slave select line 22
SPI slave select line 23
SPI slave select line 24
SPI slave select line 25
SPI slave select line 26
SPI slave select line 27
SPI slave select line 28
SPI slave select line 29
SPI slave select line 30
SPI slave select line 31
Default SPI device clock mode

briefdescription.para: Get an spi device by spi device id. For how to use spi device hal refer to Functions in spi device structure.

detaileddescription.para:
spi_id
ID of spi, defined by user
!NULL
Pointer to an spi device structure
NULL
Failed to find the spi device by spi_id
Need to implemented by user in user code get one designware device structure

briefdescription.para: Definitions for spi device hardware layer.

detaileddescription.para: Provide common definitions for spi device, then software developer can develop spi driver following this definitions, and the applications can directly call this definition to realize functions
